channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What We Know About the Deadly Shooting at Brown University
item.description: Two people were killed and nine others injured during an attack on the Rhode Island campus. Officials were searching for a gunman late Saturday.

item.title: 3 Americans Killed in ISIS Attack in Syria, Trump Says, Vowing to Retaliate
item.description: Two soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed while supporting counterterror operations, the Pentagon said. They are the first U.S. casualties i...

item.title: Gunshots, Sirens and a Manhunt Transform Brown’s Campus
item.description: A typical Saturday night on the Ivy League campus was shaken by the killing of two people and the wounding of 9 others.

item.title: AfD Pushes to Publish German Information That Officials Say May Help Russia
item.description: Opponents of AfD lawmakers say that their push to publish sensitive details about national security could benefit Russian military planning.

item.title: Flight Returns to Dulles After Engine Failure During Takeoff, F.A.A. Says
item.description: United Airlines Flight 803, which was headed to Tokyo, safely landed at Washington Dulles International Airport on Saturday, officials said.

item.title: At least 2 killed and 8 injured hurt in shooting at Brown University with suspect still at large
item.description: The suspect was a male who was dressed in black and last seen leaving the building, said Timothy O’Hara, Deputy Chief of Police.

item.title: AfD Pushes to Publish German Information That Officials Say May Help Russia
item.description: Opponents of AfD lawmakers say that their push to publish sensitive details about national security could benefit Russian military planning.

item.title: How Did the C.I.A. Lose a Nuclear Device in the Himalayas?
item.description: A plutonium-packed generator disappeared on one of the world’s highest mountains in a covert mission that the U.S. will not talk about.

item.title: In Rome, the King of Paparazzi Is a Star in His Own Right
item.description: Rino Barillari has been snapping photos of, and sparring with, the famous for 65 years, from Princess Margaret to Lady Gaga, Peter O’Toole to Spike Le...

item.title: 3 Americans Killed in ISIS Attack in Syria, Trump Says, Vowing to Retaliate
item.description: Two soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed while supporting counterterror operations, the Pentagon said. They are the first U.S. casualties i...

item.title: Big 12 in advanced talks for deal with RedBird-backed fund
item.description: The partnership would offer the 16 member universities a line of credit of roughly $30 million each and is close to being finalized.

item.title: Danish intelligence report warns of U.S. economic leverage and military threat under Trump
item.description: “China and Russia, together with other like-minded states, are seeking to reduce Western–and particularly US–global influence," the report said.

item.title: U.S., Mexico strike deal to settle Rio Grande water dispute
item.description: Both governments agreed that Mexico will deliver an additional 202,000 acre-feet of water beginning the week of Dec. 15 and finalize a broader distrib...

item.title: Microsoft AI boss Suleyman opens up about his peers and calls Elon Musk a ‘bulldozer’ with ‘superhuman capabilities to bend reality to his will’
item.description: "And somehow he sort of mostly manages to pull off what appears to be impossible."

item.title: Six U.N. Peacekeepers Killed in Drone Strike in Sudanese Battle Zone
item.description: The strike on a United Nations base in the southern Kordofan region was the deadliest single episode for the body’s personnel in Sudan’s civil war.
